policy.title: General Provisions
policy.content: The league shall be governed by the organizing committee or sports board. All participating teams must be duly registered before the start of the competition, Each team must be submit a list of players and officials before kickoff (e.g. 18-25 players). All players must meet eligibility requirements (e.g, students status, Matric Number, etc).

policy.title: Match Regulations
policy.content: Matches shall be played in accordance with the Laws of the Game as defined by FIFA.  Duration of matches: 90 minutes (two halves of 45 minutes) with a 15-minute break. Shorter durations can be applied for school tournaments.

policy.title: Team Composition
policy.content:
A team may start a match with a minimum of 7 players and a maximum of 11 players.
Up to 5 substitutions per match are allowed.
Players must wear jerseys with unique numbers, shin guards, and appropriate footwear.

policy.title: Point System
policy.content:
Win: 3 points
Draw: 1 point
Loss: 0 points
Teams are ranked by total points, goal difference, goals scored (in that order)

policy.title: Disciplinary Measures
policy.content:
Protest against match officials and team may result into suspension and fines.
Accumulation of yellow cards may result in a suspension.
Players, coaches, and fans must respect match officials and opponents.
Violence, cheating , or abusive behavior will be penalised

policy.title: Match Officials
policy.content:
Only Certified referees and assistant referees will officiate matches.
Referees' decisions on the field is final.
Match officials must submit reports after every game.

policy.title: Match Scheduling
policy.content:
All matches must begin at the scheduled time
Failure to appear within 15 minutes of kickoff time results in a walkover.
Only the organizing committee can postpone or reschedule matches.
